Module nl.fontys.sebivenlo.ranges
Package nl.fontys.sebivenlo.pgtypes

Interface Range<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the demarcation type. Type of start and end.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntegerRange, LocalDateRange, LocalDateTimeRange, LongRange
    public interface Range<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>
    A range reason of existence is testing for overlaps. The range should comply to the invariant that the start is less or equal it's end. Depending on the type, this can mean start is (left of, before, lower) than end, or equal to end. This range definition is of the half open type. The start is included in the range, the end is not. The mathematical notation for half open ranges of this kind is [start,end), indeed with two different brackets. The square bracket is the closed end, the parenthesis is at the open end.

    • Method Detail

      • getStart

        T getStart()
        Get the start demarcation of this range. Start is part of this range.
        Returns:
        start

      • getEnd

        T getEnd()
        Get the end demarcation of this range. All points in the range are before (less than) the end of this range.
        Returns:
        end

      • contains

        default boolean contains​(T point)
        Is a point contained in this range.
        Parameters:
        point - the point
        Returns:
        true is point not before start and not after end.

      • isBetween

        default boolean isBetween​(T a,
                          T b,
                          T inBetween)
        Is a midpoint between a (inclusive) and b (exclusive).
        Parameters:
        a - first point
        b - second
        inBetween - point
        Returns:
        true if inBetween is at or after a and before b

      • overlaps

        default boolean overlaps​(Range<T> other)
        Does this range overlap with another one. The overlap condition can also be tested in the database with a check constraint. See @see Range Type constraints
        Parameters:
        other - to check
        Returns:
        true on overlap with other

      • overlaps

        default boolean overlaps​(Range<T> r1,
                         Range<T> r2)
        Do two ranges overlap. Overlap means the the ranges have a non-zero sub-range in common.
        Parameters:
        r1 - first range
        r2 - second range
        Returns:
        true if there is a non zero overlap

      • getLength

        default long getLength​(java.lang.Object unit)
        Get the length of this range in some unit. The effective operation is (end-start), but since we do not know how to subtract the subtypes, that is left to the implementer. The exception thrown on incompatibility of range and unit is also left to the implementer.
        Parameters:
        unit - of measurement
        Returns:
        the length
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when the unit and this range are not compatible

      • overlap

        default long overlap​(Range<? extends T> other,
                     java.lang.Object unit)
        Compute the length that this and an other range overlap.
        Parameters:
        other - range
        unit - of measurement
        Returns:
        the length of the overlap

      • meter

        MeasureBetween<T,​java.lang.Object> meter()
        Get the method to determine distances between points.
        Returns:
        the distance from a to b.
